text: A Touch of Satin is an album by J. J. Johnson's Quartet which was released on the Columbia label.Discogs album entry accessed July 18, 2016Watts, R., Callahan, M., Edwards, D. and Eyries, P. Columbia Main Series, Part 13: CL 1700-1799/CS 8500-8598 (1961-1962), accessed July 18, 2016The Complete Columbia J.J. Johnson Small Group Sessions - Liner Notes , accessed July 18, 2016 ==Reception== Allmusic awarded the album 3 stars. ==Track listing== # "Satin Doll" (Duke Ellington) - 4:28 # "Flat Black" (J. J. Johnson) - 4:17 # "Gigi" (Frederick Loewe, Alan Jay Lerner) - 3:19 # "Bloozineff" (Johnson) - 3:38 # "Jackie-ing" (Thelonious Monk) - 4:19 # "Goodbye" (Gordon Jenkins) - 2:08 # "Full Moon and Empty Arms" (Buddy Kaye, Ted Mossman) - 4:30 # "Sophisticated Lady" (Ellington, Irving Mills, Mitchell Parish) - 2:33 # "When the Saints Go Marching In" (traditional) - 6:10 *Recorded at Columbia 30th Street Studios on December 15, 1960 (tracks 1-4), December 21, 1960 (tracks 6 & 9) and January 12, 1961 (tracks 5, 7 & 8) ==Personnel== *J. J. Johnson - trombone *Victor Feldman - piano, vibraphone, celeste *Sam Jones - bass *Louis Hayes - drums ==References== Category:J. J. Johnson albums Category:1962 albums Category:Albums produced by Teo Macero Category:Columbia Records albums
title: A Touch of Satin
